description: Wales suffer a second successive defeat of their Netball World Cup campaign as they are thumped 75-40 by Jamaica in Pool C in Cape Town.
title: Netball World Cup 2023: Jamaica 75-40 Wales
title_page: Netball World Cup 2023: Jamaica 75-40 Wales - BBC Sport
maintext:
Wales suffered a second successive defeat of their Netball World Cup campaign as they were hammered by Jamaica in Pool C in Cape Town.
Jamaica, the 2022 Commonwealth Games silver medallists, led 23-11 after a first quarter in which Wales had rallied from an early 6-1 deficit.
Wales trailed 44-23 at half-time and were then 58-29 down as the Sunshine Girls dominated the third quarter.
And there was no respite as Jamaica went on to win 75-40.
Welsh Feathers coach Emily Handyside made one starting line-up change from their opening 61-50 defeat by hosts South Africa with Shona O'Dwyer coming in for Clare Jones at centre.
Jamaica beat Welsh Feathers' next opponents Sri Lanka 105-25 in their opener.
Welsh Feathers, who are world ranked ninth, must beat the Lionesses, ranked 15th, on Sunday (08:00 BST) to reach the classification rounds.
Jamaica head into to a showdown with South Africa later on Sunday that will determine who tops the group.
